elements.title: pizza dolce di Beridde (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the pizza dolce di Beridde (pictured) was reportedly the favorite dessert of Pope Benedict XVI?

elements.title: John Hoke III (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Hoke III, who is dyslexic and the chief design officer of Nike, has described drawing as his first language?

elements.title: The Vision of God (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Vision of God sparked controversy in Mexican radio?

elements.title: Retro Atari Classics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Atari hired a number of graffiti artists for the remixed versions of classic arcade games in Retro Atari Classics?

elements.title: Albert Luthuli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albert Luthuli was the first African to win the Nobel Peace Prize?

elements.title: Bicentennial Capitol Mall State Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bicentennial Capitol Mall State Park, modeled on the National Mall in Washington, D.C., was created to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the statehood of Tennessee in 1996?

elements.title: Michael O'Sullivan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1819 Michael O'Sullivan, a member of the Legislative Assembly of Lower Canada, fought a duel in Montreal with William Caldwell over a proposal to create the Montreal General Hospital?

elements.title: "desert" in Maine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there is a "desert" in Maine?
